name: In Search of Gold
description:
Set in the once thriving colonial gold mining township of Kolar Gold Fields (KGF), In Search of Gold attempts to weave together the different lived and remembered histories of people who built this highly profitable enterprise. Against the background of the grim imagery of the now defunct mining operations, the film brings together narratives of collective socio-political struggles of the past, nostalgia for lost privileges and communities, and the anxiety of an uncertain future, of a fragmented society.

Join filmmaker Basav Biradar and physicists Nirmal Raj and Palahalli Vishwanath as they explore the legacy of Kolar Gold Fields (KGF) from both historical and scientific perspectives.

name: What is in Bengaluru’s water and soil?

location.name: Ashoka Trust For Research In Ecology And The Environment (ATREE)
location.address: Ashoka Trust For Research In Ecology And The Environment (ATREE), Bangalore

description:
How do we examine pollution of water and soil through a scientific lens? How can monitoring pollution levels help address urban challenges?

Join Priyanka Jamwal and her team at the Water and Soil laboratory at the Ashoka Trust For Research In Ecology And The Environment (ATREE). We will explore the scientific methods used to monitor and analyse water and soil pollution. Participants will tour the lab and learn how data on pollution is collected, processed, and used to tackle environmental problems. The visit will also demonstrate how this data is applied to plan, design, and evaluate solutions aimed at improving water and soil quality.

name: Quiz: Spilling the 'beans' on Bengaluru
description:
From urban myths about its name to misconceptions about which areas and localities are a part of Bengaluru – the city is a quizzer’s paradise! Join us for a quiz that tries to spill the beans on a city that is in many ways a mix of surprise, contradictions and unpredictability.

Written Quiz. Teams of two.

name: Grasping the Genes: On Biomarkers in Medicine
description:
How is novel research in medicine redefining our process of diagnosing and treating diseases? Join biologist Kshitish K Acharya as he takes us through current research which attempts to quantify and characterise biological molecules. Taking the example of specific diseases, Acharya will describe and contextualise the process of biological research in identifying 'biomarkers.' Biomarkers are molecules which are strongly associated with a specific biological event. These biomarkers help predict onset of disease (diagnostics), its progress (prognostics) and monitoring, as well as drug development (therapeutics)—including ‘personalized medicine’. Cutting-edge technologies today have enabled screening an entire set of molecules in a single experiment. Join us to discover the research processes and technological advancements that are shaping modern medicine today.

This lecture will be conducted in Kannada.
